from datetime import datetime
import calendar
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
import warnings

def get_last_day_prev_month(to_date):
    current_month = int(to_date[4:6])
    current_year = int(to_date[:4])

    previous_month = (current_month - 1) if current_month > 1 else 12
    previous_year = current_year if current_month > 1 else (current_year - 1)

    # Calculating the last day of the month
    last_day = calendar.monthrange(previous_year, previous_month)[1]

    # Creating a string date for last month
    return f"{previous_year}-{str(previous_month).zfill(2)}-{str(last_day).zfill(2)}"

def cost_populate_vm_columns(cost_df):
    # Populating the Azure Hybrid Benefit Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Azure_Hybrid_Benefit', F.when(F.col('MeterSubCategory').contains('Windows'), "Not Enabled")\
                                                         .when(F.col('ServiceInfo2') == 'Windows Server BYOL', "Enabled")\
                                                         .otherwise('Not Supported'))
    # Populating the isRIUsage Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('IsRIUsage',
                                 F.when(F.col('ReservationId').isNull(), 'On Demand Usage')\
                                  .otherwise('RI Usage'))
    return cost_df

def cost_extend_additional_info(cost_df):
    # Extend AdditionalInfo Column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AdditionalInfo', F.from_json('AdditionalInfo', 'map<string,string>', options={'inferSchema': 'true'}))

    # Creating an ID column
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('id', F.monotonically_increasing_id())

    # Creating a list of columns we want to keep
    cols_to_keep = ["UsageType", 
                    "ImageType",
                    "ServiceType",
                    "VMName",
                    "VMApplicationName",
                    "VMProperties",
                    "VCPUs",
                    "AHB",
                    "vCores",
                    "RINormalizationRatio",
                    "ConsumedQuantity",
                    "DatabaseName"]

    for col in cols_to_keep:
        cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_' + col, F.coalesce(F.col(f'AdditionalInfo.{col}'), F.lit(None)))
    return cost_df

def cost_AHB_column(cost_df):

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ai_VCPUs', F.col('ai_VCPUs').cast('int'))
    cost_df = cost_df.na.fill({'ai_VCPUs' : 0})
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AHB_CPUs', F.when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 0, 0)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 8, 8)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') < 16, 16)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') == 20, 24)\
                                              .when(F.col('ai_VCPUs') > 20, F.col('ai_VCPUs'))\
                                              .otherwise(0))
    return cost_df

def cost_set_instance_name(cost_df):
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Instance_Name', F.when(F.col('ai_VMName').isNull(), F.col('ResourceName'))\
                                                   .when(F.col('ai_VMName').isNotNull(), F.col('ai_VMName'))\
                                                   .otherwise(0))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('UnitPrice', F.col('UnitPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('PayGPrice', F.col('PayGPrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Quantity', F.col('Quantity').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('EffectivePrice', F.col('EffectivePrice').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('CostInBillingCurrency', F.col('CostInBillingCurrency').cast(T.DoubleType()))\
                     .withColumn('Date', F.to_date(F.col('Date'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodStartDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodStartDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))\
                     .withColumn('BillingPeriodEndDate', F.to_date(F.col('BillingPeriodEndDate'), 'MM/dd/yyyy'))

    return cost_df

def expand_cost_tags(cost_df):
    
    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationType
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), 'CostAllocationType": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationType'), 'CostAllocationType": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationType'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Storing the Tags column in a new column, and cleaning it up to fit with CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_extract(F.col('Tags'), 'CostAllocationCode": "(.*)"', 0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.regexp_replace(F.col('CostAllocationCode'), 'CostAllocationCode": "', ""))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.split(F.col('CostAllocationCode'),'"', 0).getItem(0))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationCode') == "", None).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    
    print("Cost Tags expansion complete")

    return cost_df

def replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, application_df):
    print("Creating ActiveWBS column, copying over CostAllocationCode, replacing 'TOBESPECIFIED' and empty values then filling gaps with SubscriptionWBS...")

    # Apply Upper-case for all CostAllocationTypes and Codes
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))

    # When the tag does not contain CostAllocationCode or CostAllocationType, then we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason
    invalidCostAllocationMask = F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull() | F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull()
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(invalidCostAllocationMask, F.lit('CostAllocationType or CostAllocationCode not present in Tags')))

    # When either value in mask appears in AcitveWBS, add invalid reason in new column
    validCostAllocationType = ['WBS', 'APPID', 'CI']
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(validCostAllocationType), F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationType: not APPID, CI or WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # When the values in the columns below match the mask and the cost type is WBS, then:
    # regex pattern states that the string should start with a case insensitive letter, followed by a dot, followed by either letters, numbers or dots
    pattern = r'^[a-zA-Z]\.[a-zA-Z0-9.]+$'
    rmask = F.col('CostAllocationCode').rlike(pattern)
    cost_wbs = (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS')

    # Applying valid WBS' as Active WBS'
    # 1. Where the CostAllocationCode follows the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we apply the CostAllocationCode
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(cost_wbs & rmask, F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    # 2. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, we set the ActiveWBSReason to be "Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('Invalid CostAllocationCode WBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    # 3. Where the CostAllocationCode doesn't follow the regex and the CostAllocationType is WBS, the CostAllocationType is changed to "SubscriptionWBS"
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(cost_wbs & ~rmask, F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))

    # Applying valid AppIDs as Active WBS'
    # If the CostAllocationCode is empty, we fill/replace the column ActiveWBS with Operational WBS in the application_df
    map_app = application_df.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'OperationalWBS')
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'APPID') & (cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.AppID), how='left')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('OperationalWBS')

    # Applying valid CIs as Active WBS'
    # Same here as above, but we merge the dataframes on ApplicationNames rather than AppID
    map_app = application_df.select('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS')
    # Apply join with case insensitivity
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))
    joined_df = cost_df.join(map_app, (cost_df.CostAllocationType == 'CI') & (cost_df.CostAllocationCode == map_app.ApplicationName_upper), how='left').drop('ApplicationName_upper')
    cost_df = joined_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('OperationalWBS')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    
    # Alternative 1 remove "AppID" 
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('ApplicationName', 'OperationalWBS')

    # When ActiveWBS value is string 'TOBESPECIFIED', we replace the value with None. # Why this ActiveWBS have TOBSPECIFIED value? 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')) == 'TOBESPECIFIED', F.lit(None)).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # When Subscriptions are not attached to the costs (unassigned), we fill the values with Unassigned and state the ActiveWBSReason.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('SubscriptionName') == 'Unassigned', F.lit('Unassigned Subscription, possibly unused RI/SP')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    # Now that we have filled in most places in ActiveWBS, if the rest of ActiveWBS is Null, then we apply the CostCenter WBS
    # When CostAllocationType is null, we fill it with the value from SubscriptionWBS
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'), F.lit('AppID CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'), F.lit('CI CostAllocationCode Invalid or Missing')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBS').isNull(), F.col('CostCenter')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBS'))) # Cost Center is identical to SubscriptionWBS. So we can remove subscription.json.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(~F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(validCostAllocationType), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationType', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType').isNull(), F.lit('SubscriptionWBS')).otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationType'))) #  Can be removed.

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('ActiveWBSReason').isNull() & (F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'SubscriptionWBS'), F.lit('No valid AppID, WBS or CI')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    

    # When CostAllocationType is a specific string, we fill/replace the value in ActiveWBSReason 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI', F.lit('CI WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID', F.lit('AppID WBS Lookup from SNOW')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBSReason', F.when(F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'WBS', F.lit('WBS Cost Tag used')).otherwise(F.col('ActiveWBSReason')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ActiveWBS', F.upper(F.col('ActiveWBS')))

    # For cases that where CostAllocationCode is empty, we will use AppID from SerivceNow and Application from Subscription.json to replace.
    mask3 = (F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(['APPID']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    mask4 = (F.col('CostAllocationType').isin(['CI']) & F.col('CostAllocationCode').isNull())
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode', F.when(mask3, F.col('AppID')) \
                                                       .when(mask4, F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')) \
                                                       .otherwise(F.col('CostAllocationCode'))).drop('AppID')

    return cost_df

def get_application_names(cost_df, application_df):

    # Masks for CI and AppID
    ci_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI'
    appid_mask = F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID'

    # When AppID is present, we use the application name from the Service-Now Application list
    # First convert AppID to a string, then select the desired columns
    map_app = application_df.withColumn('AppID', F.col('AppID').cast(T.StringType())).select('AppID', 'ApplicationName')

    # Apply case insensitivity merge by creating upper case columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('CostAllocationCode_upper',F.upper(F.col('CostAllocationCode')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    # Merge CostAllocationCode on APPID
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app, cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app.AppID, how='left')

    # Make copy of service now app list for second merge
    map_app_copy = map_app.alias('map_app_copy').withColumnRenamed('AppID', 'NewAppID').withColumnRenamed('ApplicationName_upper', 'NewApplicationName_upper').withColumnRenamed('ApplicationName', 'NewApplicationName')

    # Merge CostAllicationCode on ApplicationName copy
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app_copy, cost_df.CostAllocationCode_upper == map_app_copy.NewApplicationName_upper, how='left')

    # Populate original AppId and ApplicationName columns from the copied columns
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID', F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(), F.col('NewAppID')).otherwise(F.col('AppID')))
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('ApplicationName', F.when(F.col('ApplicationName').isNull(), F.col('NewApplicationName')).otherwise(F.col('ApplicationName')))

    cost_df = cost_df.drop('CostAllocationCode_upper', 'ApplicationName_upper', 'NewAppID', 'NewApplicationName_upper', 'NewApplicationName')

    # Create Application_Name column based on Application from ServiceNow to start with.
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.col('ApplicationName'))

    # Resolve CostAllocationCode and CostAllocationType typo by replacing Application_name with SubscriptionServiceNow-App value 
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'APPID') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                    .when((F.col('CostAllocationType') == 'CI') & F.col('CostAllocationCode').cast('int').isNotNull(),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App')).otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name',F.when(((F.col('CostAllocationType') == "SubscriptionWBS") | (F.col('CostAllocationType') == "WBS"))&(F.col('Application_Name').isNull()),F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))\
                                                     .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name_upper',F.upper(F.col('Application_Name')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowApplicationName_upper',F.upper(F.col('ApplicationName')))
    map_app = map_app.withColumn('ServiceNowAppID',F.col('AppID')).drop('AppID')

    # Lookup application in ServiceNow. Those applications that can be found will be merged.
    cost_df = cost_df.join(map_app,cost_df.Application_Name_upper==map_app.ServiceNowApplicationName_upper,how='left')

    # Fill empty AppID with AppID from ServiceNow
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('AppID',F.when(F.col('AppID').isNull(),F.col('ServiceNowAppID'))\
                                          .otherwise(F.col('AppID'))) 

    # Remove unused Columns
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('Application_Name_upper','ApplicationName','ServiceNowAppID','ServiceNowApplicationName_upper','ApplicationName_upper')


    # Application Name will be "Application not defined or not found" when SubscriptionServiceNow-App is equal to Application_name as well as AppID is empty.
    # This indicates that application from subscription.json file can not be found in ServiceNow. One of Application example is DATAHUB - MARKETING AND SUPPLY, not found in ServiceNow.
    # cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', F.when((F.upper(F.col('SubscriptionServiceNow-App'))==F.upper(F.col('Application_Name'))) & (F.col('AppID').isNull()),F.lit('Application not defined or not found'))\
    #                                                 .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name')))

    # For anything that left ApplicationName will be "Application not defined or not found" and For anything that left AppID will be 0.
    cost_df = cost_df.na.fill({'AppID': 0, 'Application_Name': 'Application not defined or not found'})

    # Setup dummy application reference for Danske Commodities related cost
    cost_df = cost_df.withColumn('Application_Name', 
        F.when((F.upper(F.col('SubscriptionName')).contains('DANSKE')) & (F.col('Application_Name') == 'Application not defined or not found'), 'Danske Commodities')
        .otherwise(F.col('Application_Name'))
    )

    return cost_df

def transform_cost_data(cost_df):

    warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)
    cost_df = cost_populate_vm_columns(cost_df)
    cost_df = cost_extend_additional_info(cost_df)
    cost_df = cost_AHB_column(cost_df)
    cost_df = cost_set_instance_name(cost_df)
    cost_df = expand_cost_tags(cost_df)

    return cost_df

def combine_subscriptions_and_applications(cost_df, subscription_df, application_df):
    
    cost_df = cost_df.join(subscription_df, cost_df.SubscriptionId == subscription_df.SubId, how='left')
    cost_df = cost_df.drop('SubId')

    cost_df = replace_empty_cost_fields_with_subscription_details(cost_df, application_df)
    print('WBS population complete. Populating application names')
    cost_df = get_application_names(cost_df, application_df)    
    print('App-name population complete')

    return cost_df
